segment.source: Configure Windows Firewall to Suppress Notifications When a Program Is Blocked (Windows 10)
segment.target: Configure Windows Firewall to Suppress Notifications When a Program Is Blocked (Windows 10)

segment.source: Configure Windows Firewall to Suppress Notifications When a Program Is Blocked
segment.target: Configure Windows Firewall to Suppress Notifications When a Program Is Blocked

segment.source: Configure Windows Firewall to Suppress Notifications When a Program Is Blocked
segment.target: Configure Windows Firewall to Suppress Notifications When a Program Is Blocked

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: To configure Windows Firewall to suppress the display of a notification when it blocks a program that tries to listen for network traffic and to prohibit locally defined rules, use the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security node in the Group Policy Management console.
segment.target: To configure Windows Firewall to suppress the display of a notification when it blocks a program that tries to listen for network traffic and to prohibit locally defined rules, use the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security node in the Group Policy Management console.

segment.source: Caution: If you choose to disable alerts and prohibit locally defined rules, then you must create firewall rules that allow your users’ programs to send and receive the required network traffic.
segment.target: Caution: If you choose to disable alerts and prohibit locally defined rules, then you must create firewall rules that allow your users’ programs to send and receive the required network traffic.

segment.source: If a firewall rule is missing, then the user does not receive any kind of warning, the network traffic is silently blocked, and the program might fail.
segment.target: If a firewall rule is missing, then the user does not receive any kind of warning, the network traffic is silently blocked, and the program might fail.

segment.source: We recommend that you do not enable these settings until you have created and tested the required rules.
segment.target: We recommend that you do not enable these settings until you have created and tested the required rules.

segment.source: Administrative credentials
segment.target: Administrative credentials

segment.source: To complete these procedures, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to modify the GPOs.
segment.target: To complete these procedures, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to modify the GPOs.

segment.source: To configure Windows Firewall to suppress the display of a notification for a blocked program and to ignore locally defined rules
segment.target: To configure Windows Firewall to suppress the display of a notification for a blocked program and to ignore locally defined rules

segment.source: Open the Group Policy Management Console to Windows Firewall with Advanced Security.
segment.target: Open the Group Policy Management Console to Windows Firewall with Advanced Security.

segment.source: In the details pane, in the Overview section, click Windows Firewall Properties.
segment.target: In the details pane, in the Overview section, click Windows Firewall Properties.

segment.source: For each network location type (Domain, Private, Public), perform the following steps.
segment.target: For each network location type (Domain, Private, Public), perform the following steps.

segment.source: Click the tab that corresponds to the network location type.
segment.target: Click the tab that corresponds to the network location type.

segment.source: Under Settings, click Customize.
segment.target: Under Settings, click Customize.

segment.source: Under Firewall settings, change Display a notification to No.
segment.target: Under Firewall settings, change Display a notification to No.

segment.source: Under Rule merging, change Apply local firewall rules to No.
segment.target: Under Rule merging, change Apply local firewall rules to No.

segment.source: Although a connection security rule is not a firewall setting, you can also use this tab to prohibit locally defined connection security rules if you are planning to deploy IPsec rules as part of a server or domain isolation environment.
segment.target: Although a connection security rule is not a firewall setting, you can also use this tab to prohibit locally defined connection security rules if you are planning to deploy IPsec rules as part of a server or domain isolation environment.

segment.source: Under Rule merging, change Apply local connection security rules to No.
segment.target: Under Rule merging, change Apply local connection security rules to No.

segment.source: Click OK twice.
segment.target: Click OK twice.
